meanings.definition: The practice of pretending to have medical skills or knowledge in order to deceive people.
meanings.sent1: The quackery of the fake doctor led to many people getting sicker.
meanings.sent2: She was exposed for her quackery when her patients realized she had no medical training.
meanings.sent3: The quackery of the so-called healer was finally revealed when his potions did nothing.
meanings.sent4: His quackery was like a dark cloud hanging over the trusting patients.
meanings.sent5: The quackery of the charlatan was a dangerous game of deception.

meanings.definition: The dishonest or fraudulent promotion of a product or service.
meanings.sent1: The company's quackery in advertising misled many customers into buying useless products.
meanings.sent2: Consumers were warned about the quackery of the miracle weight-loss pills.
meanings.sent3: The quackery of the salesman's pitch was so exaggerated that it became comical.
meanings.sent4: The quackery of the marketing campaign painted a false picture of the product's effectiveness.
meanings.sent5: The quackery of the advertisement was designed to lure in unsuspecting buyers.
